info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 7:13PM EDT until July 23 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Georgia, including the following counties, Lee and Terrell.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dawson, Leesburg, Albany, Smithville, Sasser, Bronwood, Parrott, Bridges Crossroad, Dawson Municipal A/P, Chickasawhatchee, Olivers Mill, Yeomans, Herod, Oakville, Armena, Graves, Neyami, Jordan Place and Clarks Mill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING
